intro: Aletes, commonly known as the "false heather," is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in moist, acidic soils in woodland or heathland environments. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Aletes has evergreen foliage, with leathery leaves that remain throughout the year. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging soil conditions.
